comment: "NYDN pays a flat $150 USD for op-eds. Had two op-eds run with them: had to follow-up for payment on the first, but the second was paid promptly (both by cheque). Easy editing process. They do expect submissions to be exclusive."
relationship: Submission/spec (piece was written prior and then submitted for publication)

comment: "Publication offered me a 1,000-word travel piece requiring two days, photos and interviews. After the deal was in place over many, many emails between myself, the editor and publicist of destination, editor sent one last email: "By the way, we don't offer pay for this." When I wrote back asking for $50 in gas money, the editor's exact reply was "Skip it" and that was the end of the matter. "
relationship: Ongoing/pre-existing relationship with editor or publication

comment: "I also submitted a photo, which was at first paid $50. When the story became more important after a few hours, the News paid $300 to keep exclusive right to that photo for one day. After that day I was allowed to sell the photo elsewhere."
relationship: Referral (you had a connection who connected you to the editor)

comment: "Had to ask for Daily News to pay me! Weeks went by after it ran, and I approached editor, who said, 'Okay. $150.'""
